rules: Rule1: Whenever a research team discovered a medicinal plant, a drug formula was patented by a patent office.
Rule2: If a research team discovered a medicinal plant, then it is not the case that the research team was awarded an innovation prize.
Rule3: Either a research team discovered a medicinal plant or a side effect was toxic to human subjects.
Rule4: A technology was licensed to a biotech firm, or if a research team discovered a medicinal plant, then the research team was awarded an innovation prize.
Rule5: If an active compound was synthesized in a laboratory, then a scientific paper was published in a research journal.
Rule6: Whenever a drug formula was patented by a patent office, an active compound was synthesized in a laboratory.
Rule7: Under the condition that a research project was funded by a grant provider, a drug product was marketed in a healthcare market.
Rule8: A research project was funded by a grant provider, or an academic institution partnered with a pharma company.
Rule9: If an academic institution partnered with a pharma company, then if a research team discovered a medicinal plant, a scientific paper was published in a research journal.
Rule10: Provided that a drug product was marketed in a healthcare market, a clinical trial was approved by a regulatory agency.
facts: Fact1: A technology was not licensed to a biotech firm.
Fact2: A scientific paper was not published in a research journal.
Fact3: A clinical trial was not approved by a regulatory agency.

question: A side effect was toxic to human subjects.
